org.zoolu.sip.provider

Class SipStack

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.zoolu.tools.Configure
      • org.zoolu.sip.provider.SipStack

  • public class SipStack
extends Configure
    SipStack includes all static attributes used by the sip stack.

    Static attributes includes the logging configuration, default SIP port, deafult supported transport protocols, timeouts, etc.

    • Field Detail

      • release

        public static final java.lang.String release
        Release
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • authors

        public static final java.lang.String authors
        Authors
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • default_port

        public static int default_port
        Default SIP port. Note that this is not the port used by the running stack, but simply the standard default SIP port.
        Normally it sould be set to 5060 as defined by RFC 3261. Using a different value may cause some problems when interacting with other unaware SIP UAs.

      • default_transport_protocols

        public static java.lang.String[] default_transport_protocols
        Default supported transport protocols.

      • default_nmax_connections

        public static int default_nmax_connections
        Default max number of contemporary open transport connections.

      • use_rport

        public static boolean use_rport
        Whether adding 'rport' parameter on via header fields of outgoing requests.

      • force_rport

        public static boolean force_rport
        Whether adding (forcing) 'rport' parameter on via header fields of incoming requests.

      • max_forwards

        public static int max_forwards
        default max-forwards value (RFC3261 recommends value 70)

      • retransmission_timeout

        public static long retransmission_timeout
        starting retransmission timeout (milliseconds); called T1 in RFC2361; they suggest T1=500ms

      • max_retransmission_timeout

        public static long max_retransmission_timeout
        maximum retransmission timeout (milliseconds); called T2 in RFC2361; they suggest T2=4sec

      • transaction_timeout

        public static long transaction_timeout
        transaction timeout (milliseconds); RFC2361 suggests 64*T1=32000ms

      • clearing_timeout

        public static long clearing_timeout
        clearing timeout (milliseconds); T4 in RFC2361; they suggest T4=5sec

      • single_timer

        public static boolean single_timer
        Whether using only one thread for all timer instances.

      • early_dialog

        public static boolean early_dialog
        Whether 1xx responses create an "early dialog" for methods that create dialog.

      • default_expires

        public static int default_expires
        Default 'expires' value in seconds. RFC2361 suggests 3600s as default value.

      • ua_info

        public static java.lang.String ua_info
        UA info included in request messages in the 'User-Agent' header field. Use "NONE" if the 'User-Agent' header filed must not be added.

      • server_info

        public static java.lang.String server_info
        Server info included in response messages in the 'Server' header field Use "NONE" if the 'Server' header filed must not be added.

      • LOG_LEVEL_TRANSPORT

        public static int LOG_LEVEL_TRANSPORT
        Base level (offset) for logging Transport events

      • LOG_LEVEL_TRANSACTION

        public static int LOG_LEVEL_TRANSACTION
        Base level (offset) for logging Transaction events

      • LOG_LEVEL_DIALOG

        public static int LOG_LEVEL_DIALOG
        Base level (offset) for logging Dialog events

      • LOG_LEVEL_CALL

        public static int LOG_LEVEL_CALL
        Base level (offset) for logging Call events

      • LOG_LEVEL_UA

        public static int LOG_LEVEL_UA
        Base level (offset) for logging UA events

      • debug_level

        public static int debug_level
        Log level. Only logs with a level less or equal to this are written.

      • log_path

        public static java.lang.String log_path
        Path for the log folder where log files are written. By default, it is used the "./log" folder. Use ".", to store logs in the current root folder.

      • max_logsize

        public static int max_logsize
        The size limit of the log file [kB]

      • log_rotations

        public static int log_rotations
        The number of rotations of log files. Use '0' for NO rotation, '1' for rotating a single file

      • rotation_scale

        public static int rotation_scale
        The rotation time scale

      • rotation_time

        public static int rotation_time
        The rotation time value
